results.content: A good insight into JQuery. It's just let down a little as the code in the videos isn't built up in a way that someone can type along with it, as he does in some of his other videos. That said, the code is supplied, and the later videos are much better. Laurence's latest videos on Apps Script, etc, are to a better standard and easier to follow. However, I would still recommend the course as I did learn a lot, and have some code examples to use for the future, especially the JQuery methods and use with AJAX. The last project is a great thing to finish on too.

response.content: This course was an overview of jQuery course
response.content_html: This course was an overview of jQuery course

results.content: Horrible course, with the constant cutting and paste garbage.  For people who are new to the jQuery, the constant pasting makes it hard for new users to follow along with what's happening. My advice, redo the course, and do it right without cutting a pasting the code in. Come on, man. Also the weird stopping, and staring again in videos when the instructor makes a mistake.

response.content: You have only done about a third of the course, some of the cutting and pasting is to save time so students don't have to watch constant typing.  This was something that was asked for by students who do not like courses where they have to spend half the time watching someone type.  The course instead focuses on the core learning material for jQuery.
